Content:: This is the order of battle for the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine. Ukrainian military commentator Yuri Butusov has presented the following initial February 2022 deployment of the Russian forces:[1] Southwestern Belarus grouping (blocking contingent against Ukrainian forces in Western Ukraine): Southeastern Belarus grouping (Kyiv offensive direction): Bryansk grouping (Chernihiv offensive direction): Kursk – Belgorod grouping (Sumy offensive direction): Voronezh grouping (Kharkiv offensive direction): Smolensk grouping (Operational reserve of the northern front) Rostov grouping (Donbas and eastern Sea of Azov offensive direction) Crimea grouping (Southern Ukraine offensive direction): Kuban grouping (operational reserve of the southern front) In April 2022, the Kremlin realised that the grouping system was not working. Army General Aleksandr Dvornikov was placed in overall charge of military operations in Ukraine. The appointment was not satisfactory and was changed in June 2022 with Colonel General Gennady Zhidko being appointed to the top position.[2]
